Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice or heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; above, part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; below, two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of bull’s head, to right; rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd is rather thick-walled and could be part of a heavy chalice
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 255, no. 443, pl. 60) (Incorrectly labelled 1888.6-1.471.b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1344) (phase 2)
